verse: The Lord said to Moses,

“You must also tell the ·people [sons; children] of Israel these things: ‘If a person in your country gives one of his children to Molech [18:21], that person must be ·killed [put to death]. It doesn’t matter if he is a ·citizen [son of Israel] or a ·foreigner living [resident alien sojourning] in Israel; you must ·throw stones at [stone] him and ·kill him [put him to death].

I will be against him and cut him off from his people, because he gave his children to Molech. He showed that he ·did not respect [profaned] my holy name, and he made my ·Holy Place [sanctuary] unclean.
The people of the ·community [land] might ·ignore [close their eyes to; or connive with] that person and not kill the one who gave his children to Molech.

But I will ·be [set my face] against him and his family, and I will cut him off from his people. I will do this to anyone who follows him in ·being unfaithful to me [prostituting himself] by worshiping Molech.

“‘I will ·be [set my face] against anyone who ·goes [turns] to mediums and ·fortune-tellers [wizards] for advice, because that person is ·being unfaithful to [prostituting himself against] me. So I will cut him off from his people.
“‘Be my holy people. Be holy because I am the Lord your God.
·Remember [Keep; Guard] and obey my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements]. I am the Lord, and I have ·made you holy [consecrated you].
“‘Anyone who curses his father or mother must be put to death. He has cursed his father or mother, so he has brought his own ·death [blood] on himself [Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16].

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations [commits adultery] with his neighbor’s wife, both the ·man and the woman are guilty of adultery and [adulterer and the adulteress] must be put to death [18:20; Deut. 22:22].

If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his father’s wife, ·he has shamed [exposing/revealing the nakedness of] his father, and both the man and his father’s wife must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:8; Deut. 22:30].

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his daughter-in-law, both of them must be put to death. What they have done is ·not natural [perverted]. They have brought ·their own deaths [blood] on themselves.

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with another man as a man does with a woman, these two men have ·done a hateful sin [committed an abomination]. They must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:22].

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations with [or marries; takes] both a woman and her mother, this is ·evil [lewd; depraved]. The people must burn that man and the two women in fire so that your people will not be ·evil [lewd; depraved].
“‘If a man has sexual relations with an animal, he must be put to death. You must also kill the animal.

If a woman approaches an animal and has sexual relations with it, you must kill the woman and the animal. They must be put to death. They have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [18:23; Ex. 22:19; Deut. 27:21].

“‘It is shameful for a brother to ·marry [take] his sister, the daughter of either his father or his mother, and ·to have sexual relations with her [he sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness]. In front of everyone they must both be cut off from their people. The man has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his sister, and he is guilty of sin [18:9].

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with a woman during her monthly period, both the woman and the man must be cut off from their people. They sinned because ·they showed the source of her blood [he uncovered her fountain and she has revealed the fountain of her blood; 18:19].

“‘Do not ·have sexual relations with [uncover the nakedness of] your mother’s sister or your father’s sister, because that would ·shame a close relative [expose one’s own flesh]. Both of you are guilty of this sin [18:12–13].

“‘If a man ·has sexual relations [lies] with his uncle’s wife, he has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his uncle. That man and his uncle’s wife will die without children; they are guilty of sin.
“‘It is unclean [in a ritual sense] for a man to ·marry [take] his brother’s wife. That man has ·shamed [exposed/revealed the nakedness of] his brother, and they will have no children [18:16].

“‘·Remember [Keep; Guard] all my ·laws [statutes; ordinances; requirements] and ·rules [regulations], and obey them. I am leading you to your own land, and if you obey my laws and rules, that land will not ·throw [vomit] you out.

I am ·forcing [driving] out ahead of you the people who live there. Because they did all these sins, I have hated them. Do not live ·the way those people lived [according to the statutes/ordinances/requirements of that nation].

“‘I have told you that you will ·get [inherit] their land, which I will give to you as your ·very own [possession]; it is a ·fertile land [land flowing with milk and honey; Ex. 3:8]. I am the Lord your God, and I have set you apart from other people and made you my own.

So you must treat clean [in a ritual sense] animals and birds differently from unclean animals and birds. Do not make yourselves detestable by any of these unclean birds or animals or things that crawl on the ground, which I have made unclean for you [11:1–47].
So you must be holy to me because I, the Lord, am holy, and I have set you apart from other people to be my own.
“‘A man or woman who is a medium or a ·fortune-teller [wizard] must be put to death. You must stone them to death; they have brought ·it [blood] on themselves [19:31; 20:6].’”
